info.title: Altinn App Api
info.description:
App API description for both end users and service owners, as well as open metadata information

All operations* described within this document require authentication and authorization. Read more at https://docs.altinn.studio/authentication/guides

All GET operations* and POST operations may return or contain, respectively, personally identifiable information (PII; national identity numbers and names).

For more information about this product, see https://docs.altinn.studio/api/apps

* Except the metadata APIs

post.summary: Perform a task action on an instance

parameters.name: org
parameters.description: unique identifier of the organisation responsible for the app

parameters.name: app
parameters.description: application identifier which is unique within an organisation

parameters.name: instanceOwnerPartyId
parameters.description: unique id of the party that this the owner of the instance

parameters.name: instanceGuid
parameters.description: unique id to identify the instance

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The currently used language by the user (or null if not available)

get.summary: Method to retrieve the supported languages from the application.

Get the application metadata "https://altinncdn.no/toolkits/altinn-app-frontend/4/schemas/json/application/application-metadata.schema.v1.json"
            
If org and app does not match, this returns a 409 Conflict response

parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organisation responsible for the app.

parameters.name: app
parameters.description: Application identifier which is unique within an organisation.

parameters.name: checkOrgApp
parameters.description: Boolean get parameter to skip verification of correct org/app

get.summary:
Get the application XACML policy file
            
If org and app does not match, this returns a 409 Conflict response

post.summary:
Creates a new instance of an application in platform storage. Clients can send an instance as json or send a
multipart form-data with the instance in the first part named "instance" and the prefill data in the next parts, with
names that correspond to the element types defined in the application metadata.
The data elements are stored. Currently calculate and validate is not implemented.

parameters.name: org
parameters.description: unique identifier of the organisation responsible for the app

parameters.name: app
parameters.description: application identifier which is unique within an organisation

parameters.name: instanceOwnerPartyId
parameters.description: unique id of the party that is the owner of the instance

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The currently active user language

post.description:
Add to an instance that a given stakeholder considers the instance as no longer needed by them. The stakeholder has
collected all the data and information they needed from the instance and expect no additional data to be added to it.
The body of the request isn't used for anything despite this being a POST operation.

parameters.name: instanceOwnerPartyId
parameters.description: The party id of the instance owner.

parameters.name: instanceGuid
parameters.description: The id of the instance to confirm as complete.

get.summary:
Validate an app instance. This will validate all individual data elements, both the binary elements and the elements bound
to a model, and then finally the state of the instance.

parameters.name: org
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organisation responsible for the app.

parameters.name: app
parameters.description: Application identifier which is unique within an organisation

parameters.name: instanceOwnerPartyId
parameters.description: Unique id of the party that is the owner of the instance.

parameters.name: instanceGuid
parameters.description: Unique id to identify the instance

parameters.name: ignoredValidators
parameters.description: Comma separated list of validators to ignore

parameters.name: onlyIncrementalValidators
parameters.description: Ignore validators that don't run on PATCH requests

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The currently used language by the user (or null if not available)

get.summary:
Validate a single data element (deprecated).
Use `/{org}/{app}/instances/{instanceOwnerPartyId}/{instanceGuid}/validate` with filters as needed.

parameters.name: org
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the organisation responsible for the app.

parameters.name: app
parameters.description: Application identifier which is unique within an organisation

parameters.name: instanceOwnerId
parameters.description: Unique id of the party that is the owner of the instance.

parameters.name: instanceId
parameters.description: Unique id to identify the instance

parameters.name: dataGuid
parameters.description: Unique id identifying specific data element

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The currently used language by the user (or null if not available)

partyId.description: Gets or inits the ID of the party

AuthorizedOrganizationDetails.description: Represents the details of an authorized organization.

id.description: Gets or sets the data element id

DataElementFileScanResult.description: File scan result for an individual data element.

data.description: The form data of the data element

DataModelPairResponse.description: Pair of Guid and data object.

ignoredValidators.description:
List of validators to ignore during the patch operation.
Issues from these validators will not be run during the save operation, but the validator will run on process/next

DataPatchRequest.description: Represents the request to patch data on the Altinn.App.Api.Controllers.DataController.

ignoredValidators.description:
List of validators to ignore during the patch operation.
Issues from these validators will not be run during the save operation, but the validator will run on process/next

DataPatchRequestMultiple.description:
Represents the request to patch data on the Altinn.App.Api.Controllers.DataController in the
version that supports multiple data models in the same request.

validationIssues.description: The validation issues that were found during the patch operation.

newDataModel.description: The current data model after the patch operation.

DataPatchResponse.description: Represents the response from a data patch operation on the Altinn.App.Api.Controllers.DataController.

validationIssues.description: The validation issues that were found during the patch operation.

newDataModels.description: The current data in all data models updated by the patch operation.

DataPatchResponseMultiple.description: Represents the response from a data patch operation on the Altinn.App.Api.Controllers.DataController.

uploadValidationIssues.description: List of the validators that reported to have relevant changes after a new data element was added

DataPostErrorResponse.description: Extension of ProblemDetails to include Validation issues from the file upload.

newDataElementId.description: The Id of the created data element

validationIssues.description: List of validation issues that reported to have relevant changes after a new data element was added

newDataModels.description: List of updated DataModels caused by dataProcessing

data.description: File scan result for individual data elements.

InstanceFileScanResult.description: Light weight model representing an instance and it's file scan result status.

partyId.description: The party id of the instance owner (also called instance owner party id).

personNumber.description: Person number (national identification number) of the party. Null if the party is not a person.

organisationNumber.description: The organisation number of the party. Null if the party is not an organisation.

username.description: The username of the party. Null if the party is not self identified.

InstanceOwnerResponse.description: Represents information to identify the owner of an instance.

id.description: The unique id of the instance {instanceOwnerId}/{instanceGuid}.

appId.description: The id of the application this is an instance of, e.g. {org}/{app22}.

org.description: Application owner identifier, usually a abbreviation of organisation name. All in lower case.

dueBefore.description: The due date to submit the instance to application owner.

visibleAfter.description: Date and time for when the instance should first become visible for the instance owner.

data.description: A list of data elements associated with the instance

presentationTexts.description: The presentation texts for the instance.

dataValues.description: The data values for the instance.

created.description: The date and time for when the element was created.

createdBy.description: The id of the user who created this element.

lastChanged.description: The date and time for when the element was last edited.

lastChangedBy.description: The id of the user who last changed this element.

InstanceResponse.description: Represents the response from an API endpoint providing a list of key-value properties.

dueBefore.description: Gets or sets the due date to submit the instance to application owner.

visibleAfter.description: Gets or sets date and time for when the instance should first become visible for the instance owner.

prefill.description: Gets or sets the prefill values for the instance.

sourceInstanceId.description: Gets or sets the id of the instance to use as a source for the new instance.

InstansiationInstance.description: Specialized model for instansiation of instances

success.description: Indicates whether a person was found or not.

LookupOrganisationResponse.description: Contains the result of an organisation lookup.

socialSecurityNumber.description: The social security number of the person to search for.

lastName.description: The last name of the person to search for.

LookupPersonRequest.description: Data transfer object for the request to search for a person.

success.description: Indicates whether a person was found or not.

LookupPersonResponse.description: Contains the result of a person search request.

NotificationStatus.description: Represents the state of a notification.

ssn.description: Person number (national identification number) of the party. Null if the party is not a person.

orgNumber.description: The organisation number of the party. Null if the party is not an organisation.

dataElementId.description: The guid for the data element this patch applies to

PatchListItem.description: Item class for the list of patches with Id

actionOnBehalfOf.description: The organisation number of the party the user is acting on behalf of

tags.description: A list of tags to set on the data element represented as string values.

SetTagsRequest.description: Represents the request body for setting a set of tags on a data element.

tags.description: A list of tags represented as string values.

validationIssues.description: List of validation issues that changed as a result of updating tags.

SetTagsResponse.description: Represents the response from the set tags API endpoint providing a list of tags and current validation issues.

delegationSuccessful.description: Whether delegation of signing rights has been successful.

partyId.description: The party id of the signee.

SigneeState.description: Contains information about a signee and the current signing status.

SigningAuthorizedOrganizationsResponse.description: Represents the response from the API when fetching organizations the user is authorized to sign on behalf of.

dataElements.description: The data elements that should be signed.

SigningDataElementsResponse.description: Response that contains the data elements that should be signed.

signeeStates.description: The signees for the current task.

SigningStateResponse.description: Contains the result of a get signees request.

dueBefore.description: Gets or sets the due date to submit the instance to application owner.

lastChanged.description: Last changed date time in UTC format.

lastChangedBy.description: Full name of user to last change the instance.

SimpleInstance.description: A simplified instance model used for presentation of key instance information.

tags.description: A list of tags represented as string values.

TagsList.description: Represents the response from an API endpoint providing a list of tags.

buttonId.description: The id of the button that was clicked

ignoredValidators.description: Ignored validators that should not be evauated as part of this action

onBehalfOf.description: The organisation number of the party the user is acting on behalf of

updatedDataModels.description: Data models that have been updated

updatedValidationIssues.description:
Gets a dictionary of updated validation issues. The first key is the data model id, the second key is the validator id
Validators that are not listed in the dictionary are assumed to have not been executed

clientActions.description: Actions the client should perform after action has been performed backend

redirectUrl.description: If the action requires the client to redirect to another url, this property should be set

userDefinedMetadata.description: A list of properties represented as key-value pairs.

UserDefinedMetadataDto.description: Represents the response from an API endpoint providing a list of key-value properties.
